Name: Books of Ezra and Nehemiah
Description: Timeline of the books of Ezra and Nehemiah
Notes: Following Finnegan where available, otherwise IVP (which in some cases differ by a year where both list the same date). Need to confirm regnal dates with PDBC then adjust. Assuming (as Finnegan does) that Artaxerxes is Artaxerxes I, not II as per some scholars.

Name: Return of the exiles following the proclamation of Cyrus
Start of the rebuilding of the temple
Opposition to the rebuilding of the temple
Notes: To end of Darius's reign

Name: Accusation in the reign of Ahaseurus (Xerxes)
Notes: Started reign 486

Name: Letter to King Artaxeres and his response
Notes: Artaxerxes reigned 465-424. However, this must logically predate Nehemiah 1 (445).

Name: Rebuilding the temple resumes following the prophesies of Haggai and Zechariah
Notes: Haggai's prophecy on -06-01, Aug 29th

Name: Darius confirms Cyrus's decree
Notes: Allowing some travel time!

Name: Celebration of rebuilding of the temple and the first Passover
Ezra sent to Jerusalem by Artaxerxes
Silver and gold deposited in the temple
Ezra prays about the problem of intermarriage
Ezra's proclamation that the men of Judah should assemble
Nehemiah visited by Hanani; his prayer
Notes: A problem with the dating here, as Kislev is after Nisan in the year. Finnegan doesn't discuss this. Williamson (WBC Ezra-Nehemiah p167), following Bickermann, suggests we should be following regnal, not calendar years. Whether that changes other datings relating to Persian kings is unclear.

Name: Rebuilding of the walls of Jerusalem
Notes: End date given, plus length of 52 days. (Not sure which months were 30 days, which 29, so may be one or two days off.)

Name: Appointing of gatekeepers, singers and Levites
Resettlement in Jerusalem
Notes: No end time. Months seem reasonable

Name: Dedication of the walls of Jerusalem
Nehemiah's final reforms
Notes: After 433. A dating issue in that the implication of 12:44, 13:1 is that everything from 12:27 to 13:6 is at the same time, but Nehemiah is present at 12:38 but not 13:6. Following Williamson in that the dedication of the walls was not long afterwards, and 12:44 onwards is one block.

Name: Nehemiah returns to Jerusalem
Notes: After the previous. No information how much later. Worth seeing how this parallels Malachi.

Name: Zechariah
Notes: No information on when chapters 9-14 were written.

Name: Malachi
Notes: Contemporary with Nehemiah's return to Jerusalem, perhaps. IVP gives 433 in one article, 460 in another.

Name: Prophecy through Haggai to rebuild the Temple
Prophecy through Haggai to be strong because the Lord is with them
Prophecies through Haggai that the people will be blessed, and to Zerubbabel
Prophecy through Zechariah to return to the Lord
Prophecy through Zechariah of various images
Prophecy through Zechariah concerning fasting and feasting
Description: Nov 518. Unclear if all one day

Name: Zechariah's oracles concerning Israel and her enemies
Prophecies of Ezekiel
Description: Prophecies in Ezekiel which are dated.
Notes: IVP gives 593-570. Note there are quite a few textual difficulties with the numbers.

Name: Warning to Israel of the siege of Jerusalem
Prophecy about the Temple and Israel's leaders
Prophecy against Tyre
Description: First day of month, no month given. Assuming first month as per WBC best guess?
Notes: Whatever month this is in, predates the fall of Jerusalem, which is surprising. Discussion in WBC about this.

Name: Prophecy that Nebuchadnezzar will conquer Egypt
Prophecy to Egypt about Assyria (the cedar of Lebanon)
Warning to Egypt that other nations have already been destroyed
Description: No month, assuming same as previous

Name: Lamentations
Notes: (not IVP. Assuming 586 or shortly after.)

Name: Obadiah
Notes: c586 or later, from IVP

Name: Mordecai discovers the plot to assassinate Xerxes
The plot to kill the Jews; the Jews saved
Job
Description: Possible date for the book of Job in its present form. (Opinions vary from about 1500 to 150BC.) It is likely that the story in some form is much older.
Notes: WBC

Name: Ecclesiastes
Description: Likely date for Ecclesiastes in its present form.
Notes: WBC

Name: Proverbs
Description: Likely date for Proverbs in its present form. (Chapters 10-31 probably pre-date the exile)
Notes: WBC

Name: Song of Solomon
Notes: (don't have a commentary - need to check what opinions are)
